body: Data is a valuable resource to organisations of all sizes. In this module we explore what data is, why we need data and different ways to classify data types.
title: 1. What is data?

_skills.outcome: Explain the need for open data

body: Data has the potential to help grow economies, transform societies and protect the environment. In this module, we explore how governments, businesses and individuals are using open data to create new value.
title: 2. Unlocking value from open data

_skills.outcome: Describe the benefits of working with open data
Describe successful case studies of using and publishing open data

body: Clear, effective communication of the benefits from improved data usage is essential to capture your colleagues’ imaginations and gain their trust and understanding. This module will prepare you to deliver a pitch to convince your colleagues about improving their data usage.
title: 3. Convincing your colleagues

body: One of the most challenging parts of using data is communicating your findings to others, or telling a story with your data. This module looks into the four step data storytelling process and how to plan your time effectively at every stage.
title: 4. The data storytelling process

body: The growing demand for data has led to an increase in human-friendly data services. However, these only account for a small fraction of the available data on the Web. This module explores where you can start looking for  data and how to find data hidden in the web.
title: 5. Gathering data

body: Once you’ve gathered your data, how can you tell if your data is of sufficient quality? In this module we explore what data quality is, standards and checklists that you can use and Lloyd’s guidelines on data quality.
title: 6. Data quality

_skills.outcome: Define the benefits of quality open data
Describe two guidelines for open data quality

body: Having gathered data from different sources and ensured its quality, the next step is to organise that data ready to be processed. This module looks at how to design and implement a structure for a dataset that can be understood by the audience.
title: 7. Organising data

body: From organising data in a spreadsheet to more complex data formats. In this technical module we explore some of the most common data formats and structures.
title: 8. Formatting data

_skills.outcome: Identify characteristics of different data formats
List criteria for choosing the right data format

body: Data containing errors leads to analysis and visualisations containing errors. Before any analysis can take place you need  to be able to identify and remove errors from data. This module looks at common errors and useful tools to remove them.
title: 9. Cleaning data

body: Once data is clean, it is ready for analysis. This analysis does not have to use complex statistical methods. This module introduces key spreadsheet features, including pivot tables, that can help you quickly sort, filter and analyse data.
title: 10. Filtering and pivot tables

body: Data visualisations help communicate insights in an easy and quick way. However, picking the most appropriate visualisation format can be tricky. This module will enable you to to select appropriate visualisations and provide you with key examples of data visualisations.
title: 11. Data visualisation formats

body: Visualising data enables us to grasp difficult concepts or identify new patterns quickly. This module introduces the key tricks that help the human eye and brain process and understand data much faster.
title: 12. Data visualisation best practice

body: Visual representations of data vastly decrease the amount of time it takes to communicate a message. However, not all data visualisations are equal. In some cases, a combination of tricks are used to either emphasise a point or, in some cases, mislead the viewer. This module looks at such techniques and how they can be used or avoided.
title: 13. Visual deception

body: Data visualisations can be a powerful way of bringing data to life, and help others deduce meaning from data. But a data visualisation on its own is rarely enough to convey the whole story in a memorable way. This module looks at how an engaging narrative can bring a story to life.
title: 14. Narrating your story
